definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: We are going to have a test on Lesson Two next Monday.
sentences.chinese: 我们下周星期一要考第二课。

sentences.english: Be passionate about your work although toady is Monday.
sentences.chinese: 虽然今天是星期一，但是保持你的工作热情。

sentences.english: The Newcastle United star's wife, Louise Bonsall, gave birth to a girl on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 这位纽卡球星的妻子路易斯星期一给他生了一个女儿。

sentences.english: CPC's new prices took effect on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 中油的新油价已经在星期一生效。

sentences.english: The family and I planned to leave Monday for a two-week vacation in California.
sentences.chinese: 我们全家计划星期一去加州两个星期渡假。

sentences.english: Monday morning Jack presides over the meeting of management.
sentences.chinese: 星期一早上，杰克主持召开了中层干部会议。

sentences.english: A four-year-old boy died in Chennai on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一，钦奈市一个四岁的男孩死于猪流感。
今天是2009年十月十日星期一。

sentences.english: Your order can go out on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 你们的订货在星期一就可以出货。

sentences.english: Senegal says it will extradite Habre on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 塞内加尔表示将于星期一把哈布雷引渡回乍得。

sentences.english: Ann, do you have time next Monday?
People were rationed to a pound of meat a week.
sentences.chinese: 供应被限制为一星期一磅肉。

sentences.english: The Balds will go to Bangkok next Monday.
sentences.chinese: 鲍尔德一家下星期一要到曼谷去。

sentences.english: Calls to the commission rang unanswered Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一，给该委员会打电话，没人接。

sentences.english: What’s worse my back started aching this Monday.
sentences.chinese: 更糟糕的是这个星期一我的背开始痛。

sentences.english: Inamori did not confirm that number Monday.
sentences.chinese: 稻盛和夫星期一没有证实裁员的规模。
